Michael Galloy, RSI

SUMMARY: fields | routine          DETAILS: routine

.\tools\idldoc
idldoc.pro

Last modification date:
Fri Jan 14 15:57:11 2005

IDLdoc is a hypertext documentation system for IDL code. It is intended to show the API of a library of code in an easy to browse manner. It produces HTML pages -- one page per '.pro' file, as well as directory listing, overview pages, and an index of files, routines, keywords, and parameter names.

Unmarked code may be processed by IDLdoc to produce a browseable listing of routines and their arguments. But to obtain more useful results, the source can be marked to produce formatted comments in the output. Each routine has special tags to indicate particular information for IDLdoc formatting use. HTML markup tags may be used anywhere comments are expected. See the help for individual files for specifics about the tags available.

For a more an example of code that has been documented using IDLdoc, check IDLdoc's source for its comments and compare to its output.

Class listings and fields summary will be generated for files which end with __DEFINE.PRO. Use the "field" tag to make comments on each field of the class/structure defined.

An overview file can be specified with the OVERVIEW keyword to IDLdoc. This file is a plain text file with comments (which can contain HTML codes) that will be displayed on a summary page. The below tags are processed by IDLdoc.

Overview Tags
dir Comment for a directory. The first parameter to dir is the directory name relative to the root dir. The rest of the tag content is the comment.

The style of the output of IDLdoc can be changed by editing the cascading style sheet used: idldoc.css found in the same directory as IDLdoc.

This help was produced by IDLdoc.

idldoc_version private

function idldoc_version([/build])

IDLdoc version is returned.

Returns
string representing IDLdoc's current version

Keywords
build
in, optional
boolean 		set to return a string with the build date in it also

idldoc_filecopy private

procedure idldoc_filecopy, src, dst, warnings=variable

Copies the src file to dst file, overwriting the previous dst file if necessary.

Parameters
src
in, required
string 		source filename
dst
in, required
string 		destination filename; if this file exists already, it will be overwritten

Keywords
warnings
out, required
variable 		a named variable to return the number of warnings

idldoc_elim_slash private

function idldoc_elim_slash(dir)

Changes any file specification notation to the web notation ("/").

Returns
string or string array with path separators changed to "/" since the web always uses "/"

Parameters
dir
in
string or string array 		represents directory path(s)

procedure idldoc_process_tags, tag_lines, pro_dirs, comments, [warnings=variable]

Process the tags in the overview file.

Parameters

in

in
string array 		directories under root that hold .pro files
comments
in/out
variable 		comments for the pro_dirs directories; matches elementwise

Keywords
warnings
out, optional
variable 		a named variable to return the number of warnings

idldoc_write_overview private

procedure idldoc_write_overview, overview, pro_dirs, [warnings=variable], [/user], [/embed], [/nonavbar], title=title, subtitle=subtitle, footer=footer

Processes the file specified by the OVERVIEW keyword to IDLdoc (if present) and creates the 'overview.html' file that shows in the main browser frame when loading the 'index.html' file. Always shows at least all subdirectories with IDL .pro files in them.

Parameters
overview
in
string 		filename of the content to be placed in the overview.html file
pro_dirs
in
string array 		a list of the directories containing .pro code below the root directory

Keywords
warnings
out, optional
variable 		a named variable to return the number of warnings
user
in, optional
boolean 		set to give user documentation; otherwise developer documentation is produced
embed
in, optional
boolean 		if set, embeds style sheet in each HTML document
nonavbar
in, optional
boolean (def. false) 		set to exclude navbar on overview page
title
 .
subtitle
 .
footer
 .

idldoc_write_all_dirs private

procedure idldoc_write_all_dirs, pro_dirs, count, [/embed], [warnings=variable]

Writes the all-dirs.html file in the root directory.

in

Keywords
embed
in, optional
boolean 		if set, embeds style sheet in each HTML document

idldoc_find_dirs private

function idldoc_find_dirs(pro_files, ndirs)

Find the directories with .pro files in them.

Returns
string array of the directories with .pro files in them, or -1 if there are none

Parameters
pro_files
in
string array 		a string array of all the pro files under the 'root' directory
ndirs
out
variable 		the number of directories under the root directory that contain .pro files

idldoc

procedure idldoc, root=string, [footer=string], [output=string], [overview=string], [/user], [/quiet], [/silent], [/embed], [/nonavbar], [title=string], [subtitle=string], [n_warnings=variable], [/browse_routines], preformat=preformat

Calling routine for IDLdoc.

Examples
To run IDLdoc, try:
idldoc, root='C:\mycode'
where C:\mycode is the root of a directory tree containing IDL .pro files.
Requires
IDL 6.0
Author
Michael D. Galloy
Copyright
RSI, 2002

Keywords
root
in, required
string 		root directory for IDLdoc's recursive search for .pro files. IDLdoc will find any files with the '.pro' suffix and include them in its file listings. Only directories with '.pro' files in them are included in the directory listings.
footer
in, optional
string 		filename for a footer to be placed at the bottom of files; this file can contain any valid HTML
output
in, optional
string (def. same as root) 		directory in which to create the HTML output and possible subdirectories
overview
in, optional
string 		filepath to a file containing the summary of the package information about each directory in the package.
user
in, optional
boolean 		set to create a listing appropriate for users of the given library hierarchy; the default is to create documentation suited to developers. If set private routines are not shown in the documentation.
quiet
in, optional
boolean 		if set, print only warnings
silent
in, optional
boolean 		if set, print no messages
embed
in, optional
boolean 		if set, embeds style sheet in each HTML document; if this is not set, each HTML file will be looking for the cascading style sheet idldoc.css in the directory specified for the ROOT keyword
nonavbar
in, optional
boolean 		set to exclude the navigation bar at the top of each page
title
in, optional
string (def. Research Systems) 		title to place in the upper right of all generated pages
subtitle
in, optional
string (def. IDL version) 		subtitle to place in the upper right of all generated pages
n_warnings
out, optional
variable 		set to a named variable to contain the total number of warnings issued during the run
browse_routines
in, optional
boolean 		set to include a frame to browse through the routines of the current file
preformat
 .

Personal IDL library of Michael Galloy, Professional Services Engineer - Trainer/Consultant, Research Systems
For more information about these routines contact Michael Galloy
Feel free to submit a bug or feature request for any of these routines
